tab.name: intro
tab.label: Summary
tab.content: The city of Bristol has a long and colourful history, closely associated with the sea. This is still very much in evidence in the docks and quays that reach right into the centre of the city. Away from the main shopping area there are many beautiful buildings and fascinating clues to Bristol's grand past. The perfect area to explore on a Treasure Hunt!

tab.name: details
tab.label: Hunt Info
tab.content:
Hunts The pack includes a treasure trail and a bonus round.

Duration 2 hours or so, not including breaks.

Suitability Suitable for any size of group from 1 to 8, good for families. The streets of Bristol are accessible to all, though there are some hilly roads. There are one set of steps in the hunt which can be detoured.

Requirements Just a pencil and paper, and a sensible pair of shoes.

tab.name: todo
tab.label: Things to do
tab.content:
• Enjoy the huge permenant street art on Nelson Street, created by the See No Evil project.
  • Stop for a snack at the lively St Nicholas Market and explore the jumble of shops.
  • Step aboard the SS Great Britain and explore Brunel's great ship.
